intro: Drymocallis corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered goldenrod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in the late summer and early autumn. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Drymocallis corymbosa thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
